title: Cannot understand torch._C._dist_init_process_group() in the source code of dist.init_process_group()
body_html:
I am learning to use torch.distributed recently. I read the Initialization Methods in the Pytorch tutorial. However, when I go deep into the source code of init_process_group https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/distributed/init.py#L44-L101 ,
I find torch._C._dist_init_process_group(backend, init_method, world_size, group_name, rank) quite confusing.
Where can I locate torch._C._dist_init_process_group? What really happens in this function?
body_text:
I am learning to use torch.distributed recently. I read the Initialization Methods in the Pytorch tutorial. However, when I go deep into the source code of init_process_group https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/distributed/init.py#L44-L101 ,
I find torch._C._dist_init_process_group(backend, init_method, world_size, group_name, rank) quite confusing.
Where can I locate torch._C._dist_init_process_group? What really happens in this function?
body:
I am learning to use `torch.distributed` recently. I read the [Initialization Methods](http://pytorch.org/tutorials/intermediate/dist_tuto.html#initialization-methods) in the Pytorch tutorial. However, when I go deep into the source code of `init_process_group` [https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/distributed/__init__.py#L44-L101](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/distributed/__init__.py#L44-L101) , 
I find `torch._C._dist_init_process_group(backend, init_method, world_size, group_name, rank)` quite confusing.
Where can I locate `torch._C._dist_init_process_group`? What really happens in this function?
